title: Quadratic Formula
summaryMarkdown: The Quadratic Formula solves a Quadratic Function by combining coefficients into a closed expression. Its logic comes from Completing the Square and the Discriminant.

title: Quadratic Function
summaryMarkdown: A Quadratic Function draws a parabola and can be rewritten in Vertex Form or solved with the Quadratic Formula.

title: Discriminant
summaryMarkdown: The Discriminant predicts how many roots a Quadratic Function has before applying the Quadratic Formula.
aliases: b squared minus four a c

title: Completing the Square
summaryMarkdown: Completing the Square rewrites a Quadratic Function into Vertex Form and produces the Quadratic Formula derivation.

title: Linear Equation
summaryMarkdown: A Linear Equation links two expressions and can be graphed with Slope Intercept Form or solved inside a System of Equations.

title: Slope Intercept Form
summaryMarkdown: Slope Intercept Form writes a Linear Equation as y equals m x plus b and makes Linear Regression easy to compare.
aliases: y equals m x plus b

title: Vertex Form
summaryMarkdown: Vertex Form makes the turning point of a Quadratic Function explicit and is built by Completing the Square.

title: System of Equations
summaryMarkdown: A System of Equations compares multiple Linear Equation constraints to find a shared solution point.

title: Polynomial
summaryMarkdown: A Polynomial combines powers of x and includes Linear Equation and Quadratic Function cases.

title: Factoring
summaryMarkdown: Factoring breaks a Polynomial into simpler factors and can confirm roots from the Quadratic Formula.

title: Logarithm
summaryMarkdown: A Logarithm inverts an Exponential Function and appears in Optimization models and statistics scaling.

title: Binomial Theorem
summaryMarkdown: The Binomial Theorem expands powers of sums and connects Polynomial structure with combinations in statistics.

title: Limit
summaryMarkdown: A Limit describes behavior near a point and powers the Derivative Definition and the Integral.

title: Derivative Definition
summaryMarkdown: The Derivative Definition is a Limit of average change and leads directly to the Power Rule and Product Rule.

title: Power Rule
summaryMarkdown: The Power Rule differentiates x to the n quickly, often after a Derivative Definition argument and before the Chain Rule.

title: Chain Rule
summaryMarkdown: The Chain Rule handles nested functions and pairs with the Power Rule when composition appears.

title: Product Rule
summaryMarkdown: The Product Rule differentiates multiplied functions and complements the Chain Rule in Optimization tasks.

title: Integral
summaryMarkdown: An Integral accumulates small changes and connects to the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Area ideas.

title: Fundamental Theorem of Calculus
summaryMarkdown: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus links Derivative Definition ideas with the Integral into one reversible process.

title: Taylor Series
summaryMarkdown: A Taylor Series approximates a function using derivatives from the Power Rule and Chain Rule.

title: Sine Derivative
summaryMarkdown: The Sine Derivative showcases how the Derivative Definition and Chain Rule behave on trigonometric curves.

title: Exponential Function
summaryMarkdown: An Exponential Function models growth and decay, and its inverse is the Logarithm with Euler Number as the natural base.

title: Differential Equation
summaryMarkdown: A Differential Equation links a function to its derivative and often uses Exponential Function solutions.

title: Optimization
summaryMarkdown: Optimization uses the Derivative Definition and Product Rule to locate maxima or minima in models.

title: Mean
summaryMarkdown: The Mean averages values and anchors Variance, Standard Deviation, and Z Score normalization.

title: Variance
summaryMarkdown: Variance measures spread around the Mean and is the square of Standard Deviation.

title: Standard Deviation
summaryMarkdown: Standard Deviation is the square root of Variance and helps scale a Z Score.

title: Normal Distribution
summaryMarkdown: The Normal Distribution uses Mean and Standard Deviation to describe bell curve probability.

title: Z Score
summaryMarkdown: A Z Score centers data by subtracting the Mean and dividing by Standard Deviation.

title: Linear Regression
summaryMarkdown: Linear Regression fits a best Linear Equation and reports Correlation strength.

title: Correlation
summaryMarkdown: Correlation summarizes linear association and is often interpreted beside Linear Regression.

title: Bayes Theorem
summaryMarkdown: Bayes Theorem updates prior belief with evidence and is tied to Normal Distribution modeling.

title: Zero
summaryMarkdown: Zero is the additive identity used in Linear Equation intercepts and in Polynomial roots.

title: One
summaryMarkdown: One is the multiplicative identity and appears in Binomial Theorem coefficients and Exponential Function bases.

title: Pi
summaryMarkdown: Pi connects geometry and trigonometry, appearing in Sine Derivative and Normal Distribution formulas.

title: Euler Number
summaryMarkdown: Euler Number is the natural base of the Exponential Function and appears in Differential Equation solutions.
